intro: Calceolaria trilobata subsp. herzogiana, commonly known as the Herzog's slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it adapts well to nutrient-poor soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
